column4: I am having a problem. I was forced to reinstall windows. I was using the windows boot loader. Now the ubuntu line in the boot.ini is gone and I dont know what to add to boot.ini to get the bootloader back and showing ubuntu.
why don't you just install GRUB, and use that?
what else do you want GRUB to do?
right, that's what you're supposed to do, then use the instructions on that page to fix grub, using the "Live/Desktop CD" instructions, on that page
